DataElement.preferredDefinition: An integer number that identifies this Image Series.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A number of things or events standing or succeeding in order, and connected by a like relation. (from On-line Medical Dictionary)_A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._A collection of images with a common element.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A collection of images with a common element.

Concepts.definition: A collection of images with a common element.

Property.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/20/17 Versioned for OC swap (Image+Series to Image Series C69225) per Round 5 finalization task.  6/19/09 superseded; replace OC with Image Series (2436196)  6/6/07 -DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.6/19/09 created to reflect change to Image Series OC (2436196) per VCDE NCIA interim report.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: IS: A string of characters representing an Integer in base-10 (decimal), shall contain only the listed characters (0-9, +,-). [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part.::12:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/9/13 changed data type to number for reuse in CRF Standard. jc  1/6/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 6/20/17 jk Updated WF/reg status, versioned per Round 5 finalization task. 7/1/13 associated with CT Image Acquisition CRF CSI. jc  12/7/11 correct typo in definition.  6/19/09 created to reflect change to Image Series OC (2436196) per VCDE NCIA interim report.
